questions.subject: DBMS
questions.text: Which normal form eliminates partial dependency?
questions.explanation: 2NF eliminates partial dependencies where a non-prime attribute depends on part of a candidate key.

questions.subject: DBMS
questions.text: Consider a relation R(A, B, C) with FDs {A->B, B->C}. How many candidate keys does R have?
questions.explanation: A determines B, B determines C. So A determines {A, B, C}. A is the only candidate key.
